column5: Fine iced laker, Wayne, I always knew you had super powers.

Which came first?.....The chicken or the egg....  I like the Meegs myself but I do as well with the old Williams ice jig for the whitefish. Right beside Meegs who is of course using the original killer lure for Simcoe. Well ....besdides the williams ice jig of course.  As the saying goes. To many lures for to many fish and you can't just have one and everyone has their own fave which doesnt work for the next guy or girl. (breath now)...
Hi ya Andy.(misfish doing the Forest gump wave at ya)

I always have a rod rigged with a williams whitefish ice jig in half and half hammered. Whether its the #50 or #60 depends on what I'm after. I swear I could just use that one lure all hardwater season, and catch every species of fish on it!!!  Sinker

bad boyz for whities forsure, i have never had to much luck with the meegs high low rig for perch with minnows skin hooked through the back or a forege minnow in silver and black with a minnow head or berkley honey worm. BOQ walleye hopkins smoothie spoons with minnow
Maybe someone can hook him up in the little Maple Leafs fruit suit. I can't photochop.
Don't give the bugger anymore ideas fm !

I fish for brookies through the ice.  My "go to lure" is Sutton 44.  Don't even need bait.  I use it on 4 lb mono and add nothing else to the line.  Yes, it does take time for it to reach bottom but it's worth it.  Otherwise, I use a no 8 Gamakatsu Octopus hook and the head of a nightcrawler.  Minnows (dead or alive) are not allowed in my region.
Anyone using Salmo's chubby darter?  If so where can I purchase one other than Cabela's?
Jim was selling them last year at "Dad's" in Temagami. He's closed until mid December though...but checking his email once in a while.
hello all just wondering when the chips are down whats your go too lure while ice fishing mines a side winder 3",for eyes whats yours   Hawg Hunter
jig/minnow or a buckshot rattle spoon tipped with just head of a minnow.
I'll second the Buckshot Rattle spoon.
for me its gotta be a small jig and minnow.

1/4 oz walleye hawger spoon in chartreuse tape with a northland stinger.I tip the spoon with a larger minnow and the stinger with a small one.Surprising how often they'll take the small one circling round.2nd choice is a swedish pimple/red flicker blade rigged much the same.Just remember no more than four hook points.  Kerry
..and no that's not a small tube held up close to the camera....
I'll third that...
Swedish pimple
On Simcoe I almost exclusively use pickerel rigs with shiners for perch.  Not the most active style of fishing but it's effective.
I seem to have my best luck on just a plain small red hook with a shiner hooker lightly through the back with a few small splitshot roughly 12 inches up the line.
Green Monster   Wayne,maybe time for a new tank there bud.Rustola.
That's Ron's Brian! LOL  ..and by the way.. that's my go to bait for Lakers !
and boy does it get big trout
Jiggin Rap or Jiggin Shad Rap tipped with a minnow or minnow head!
O ya I heard those 2 foot albino octopus work wonders.
Na .. it's only a 10" Red October Monster Tube... but it definitely works.
Holy $^% . I guess it does.
now you're just bragging......LOL
I can see this becoming the next pink Tu Tu.
Wayne in tights????????? Yep, go for it Terry.
Hey now!! Lets just get back to Hawg Haulers question and quit screwin around ! lol
oh yeah...sorry  meegs.....for whitefish
Walleye - Silver/Black jiggin rap LAkers- White tube Whities- Bad Boyz Perch- Marmooska/maggots
Never ending saga
